question: NOWADAYS, INTERNATIONAL TOURISM IS THE BIGGEST INDUSTRY IN THE WORLD. UN FORTUNATELY, IT CREATES TENSION RATHER THAN UNDERSTANDING BETWEEN PEOPLE FROM DIFFERENT CULTURE, tO WHAT EXTEND DO YOU AGREE OR DISAGREE?
text: In  recent years, the  travelling industry has been flourishing, especially, international one; however, there are many people worried about that  this scenario building more problems than learning and accepting other cultures. In my opinion, I strongly agree with  this statement because the most of the tourists visiting  any place for entertainment purposes than learning  the cultural background of this.

One obvious reason  for believing  overseas travelling has  many negative influences on culture is that, visitors may  not show respect towards the  host nation's cultural background. In other words, many western  tourists consider that their culture is superior to others. Eventually,  they tend to misbehave there, this creates a  conflict between the host and the guests. Kingdom of Soudhi Arabia, a Muslim middle east country,  in which they follow  a certain kind of religious belief and rituals and expects those who visit there also  to follow certain rules. By contrast, If any one fails to do so, it is considered as  a sign of disrespect and may invite unwanted legal actions. Thus, disrespectful behaviour of tourists builds tensions.

Another possible factor is  that,  cultural mixing. This means,  the local community of the host country tends to observe. Gradually,   native residents may start to follow the foreign culture instead of their traditional one.  Additionally, there  is a possibility of alteration of culture too. Many native people  point out that this cultural fluidity would  perish their tradition and heritage in the name of tourism. Apart from this,   historic buildings may not  accommodate a large number visitors influx, which may result in erosion.
By way of conclusion, international tourism can cause a lot of  problems to the host country, according to some and I, personally, reaffirm this viewpoint.
